abstract: Shares of British Airways, Europe’s third-largest airline, rose the most in almost a year on speculation the carrier might attract a private-equity bid, Bloomberg News reported Monday. Shares of the airline advanced as much as 22.5 pence, or 4.9 percent, to 483.5 pence, the biggest gain since June 15, 2006 at midday.
lead_paragraph: Shares of British Airways, Europe’s third-largest airline, rose the most in almost a year on speculation the carrier might attract a private-equity bid, Bloomberg News reported Monday. Shares of the airline advanced as much as 22.5 pence, or 4.9 percent, to 483.5 pence, the biggest gain since June 15, 2006 at midday.

headline.main: BA Shares Rise as Buyout Rumors Mount
